intro: Thesium decumbens, commonly known as the prostrate thesium, is a low-growing flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its sprawling, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
